overview:
Bill Gormley is a 40-year veteran of government procurement. He spent 28 years at the General Services Administration (GSA) in positions ranging from procurement agent to Senior Executive (SES) Assistant Commissioner for the Office of Acquisition. At GSA, Bill was the driving force behind bringing commercial business practices into the agency, creating the government’s first Business Plan, and helping overhaul the GSA Schedules Program to embrace a services model. During his tenure at GSA Bill also helped design the Industrial Funding Fee (IFF), e-Library, Schedule Sales Query (SSQ), and GSAdvantage!, and helped create eBuy, all of which have brought the GSA Schedule sales from $2.5 billion to more than $40 billion today.

Bill left GSA to join the Washington Management Group, where he currently serves as president and CEO, helping clients secure and manage GSA and VA Schedule contracts. While at WMG, Bill was instrumental in facilitating the purchase of FedSources, to help create a family of firms that provide expert government contracting advice, marketing intelligence, and research services.
